DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to describe the industry in which a person's primary occupation time was spent.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:Crafts, trades, professions, or other means of earning a living.C0028811: Occupation _Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:The principal activity that a person does to earn money.:A system, often of numbered categories, for representation of data.:A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole._Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._The people or companies engaged in a particular kind of commercial enterprise; the organized action of making of goods and services for sale.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):Crafts, trades, professions, or other means of earning a living.C0028811: Occupation

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
The principal activity that a person does to earn money.

Property.preferredDefinition: The aggregate of manufacturing or technically productive enterprises in a particular field, often named after its principle product, as "the automobile industry", "the steel industry". It includes the ownership and management of companies, factories, industrial plants, etc. (From Random House Unabridged Dictionary, 2d ed)C0021267: Industry

Concepts.definition: The people or companies engaged in a particular kind of commercial enterprise; the organized action of making of goods and services for sale.
